CNN.com Student News Newsletter






 
Thursday, June 7, 2007



 Watch and Learn 
Today's broadcast begins with a report on a cyclone roaring through part of the Middle East. Then, we find out how drought conditions left archeological artifacts uncovered in Florida. And we examine tensions between the U.S. and Russia.
This Friday's edition of CNN Student News is the last broadcast of the school year. Watch for the program over the summer at CNN.com/EDUCATION.

 School reverses decision on diplomas  
Five students will get the diplomas they were denied when cheers erupted for them at a high school graduation, and school officials said Wednesday they would review a get-tough decorum policy.


 
CNN Student News is a 10-minute, commercial-free news program that airs on CNN Headline News at 3:12 a.m. EST as well as on CNN.com/EDUCATION. Created by a team of journalists and educators, the program provides the top stories of the day, segments that encourage student participation, and in-depth special reports. In addition, CNN Student News provides free curriculum at CNN.com/EDUCATION to accompany each program's content. CNN Student News, along with CNN Presents: Classroom Edition, is Turner Broadcasting's contribution to Cable in the Classroom.
